conversations.description: User submits a blog URL and asks for a full newsletter with intro and full article appended.
User provides raw text of a post and wants a three‑tweet thread summarizing key points.
User requests LinkedIn and Facebook snippets only, specifying 5 posts per platform.
User asks for a slide deck limited to 5 slides with a custom title for a product launch article.
User wants the summary limited to 3 bullet points for a concise email teaser.
User supplies a brand tone guide and asks the newsletter to match a friendly, conversational tone.
User wants a bilingual newsletter (English and Spanish) generated from a single English blog post.
User asks to combine two related blog URLs into one cohesive newsletter with merged sections.
User requests SEO‑optimized social snippets with target keywords for Twitter.
User asks for a list of standout quotes from the article to use as tweet quotes.
User wants a podcast script derived from the blog's main arguments and supporting data.
User asks for an executive summary slide deck for a board meeting, limited to 6 slides.
User supplies a technical whitepaper and wants a layperson‑friendly newsletter version.
User requests Instagram carousel captions (5 slides) based on the article summary.
User asks the system to generate a FAQ section from the blog content.
User wants a catchy email subject line derived from the article title.
User asks to adjust the brand voice to a more formal, corporate style for the newsletter.
User wants placeholder image suggestions for each slide in the generated deck.
User requests the newsletter translated into French while preserving original tone.
User asks for a one‑page PDF summary for quick stakeholder review.
User wants to merge three blog posts about sustainability into a single slide deck.
User requests a webinar outline with sections, timings, and speaker notes from the article.
User asks for a LinkedIn article version that expands the blog content with additional insights.
User wants a press‑release style announcement derived from the blog's news hook.
User requests a short marketing teaser (max 150 characters) for use in ad copy.
User wants A/B versions of the social snippets: one witty, one straightforward.
User asks the system to save the generated newsletter and slide deck to a connected Google Drive folder.
User wants the slide deck exported as a JSON structure ready for PowerPoint conversion.
User asks for custom bullet symbols (e.g., arrows) in the newsletter summary.
User wants multiple call‑to‑action variations at the end of the newsletter.
User requests a printable checklist derived from the article's actionable steps.
User asks about the maximum article length the system can handle for full repurposing.
User wants an estimate of processing time and cost for a 5,000‑word technical post.
User asks to prioritize generating social snippets first, then the slide deck later.
User requests a plagiarism check on the generated newsletter before download.
User wants a tweet per paragraph, automatically linking each tweet in a thread.
User asks to reduce jargon in the newsletter for a general‑audience mailing list.
User requests meme captions (max 2 words) that capture the article's main joke.
User wants a tagline for the product featured in the blog, suitable for ads.
User asks for speaker notes added to each slide in the deck for presenting.
User wants to provide feedback on generated snippets and request revisions.
User asks the assistant to suggest additional content ideas based on the blog topic.
User wants a series of short LinkedIn poll questions derived from the article's data.
User asks for a quick 30‑second video script summarizing the blog for TikTok.
User requests a brand‑compliant color palette suggestion for the slide deck.
User wants the newsletter formatted with markdown tables for data points.
User asks for a timeline infographic data extracted from the article for a slide.
User requests a summary that highlights only the environmental impact sections.
User wants to generate a list of hashtags for each social platform based on article keywords.
User asks for a version of the newsletter with a more playful, youthful tone.
User wants the slide deck limited to 10 slides but asks for optional speaker notes on each.
User requests an email drip‑campaign outline (3 emails) derived from the blog content.
User asks the system to flag any copyrighted material that may need attribution.
User wants a short testimonial blurbs extracted from the article for marketing use.
User asks for a quick Q&A style summary for a live AMA session based on the post.
